title: VOC Emissions and Vehicle Miles Traveled

content.question: Which of the following is most responsible for the change in the emissions of volatile organic compounds ( <math alttext="V O C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>V</mi><mi>O</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> ) from 1970 to 2020 as shown in the graph?

choices.label: A decrease in the number of vehicles fitted with catalytic converters and an increase in the number of hybrid vehicles beginning in 1970.
A decrease in the average driving distance in the United States from 1970 to 2020 that resulted from increased urbanization.

An increase in air emission standards that began in 1970 that regulated corporate average fuel economy ( <math alttext="C A F E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> ) standards.

An increase in <math alttext="V O C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>VOC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> emissions from car exhausts that resulted from increased driving distances from 1970 to 2020.

content.answer: An increase in air emission standards that began in 1970 that regulated corporate average fuel economy ( <math alttext="C A F E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>F</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> ) standards.

skill.text: Skill 7.D: Use data and evidence to support a potential solution.
